Reviews.Title: Incredible value. Though at what price.
Reviews.Author: M. Tremper
Reviews.Content: I just ordered this because of the obscenely low price ($278) compared to other TV's in this class. Like others I was very skeptical considering it was so cheap and from a brand I or anyone else had ever heard of. I considered if I didn't like it I can just return it, the price makes that risk worth it. The actual quality of TV blew me away. Before configuration the picture looks comparable to $800 screens of different brands. Blacks are black and colors are vivid. The system menu is very easy to use and attractive. The build quality is a little cheap but you get what you paid for. I've not noticed any dead pixels. Like other reviews have said the speakers are pretty crummy. I'd recommend getting a sound bar or a receiver to pipe audio out of instead. The reason it gets 3 stars instead of 5 is because it didn't come with a remote, joint to fasten the stand to the monitor, or any of the manuals or warranty information. The only things in the box were the monitor, stand, and power cable. I'm assuming this is an error on packaging's part and have written to customer support. Depending on how they get back to me may consider how I change my rating for better or worse. Till then I've got it built up on some books and controlling it with a universal remote after finding the manual on their website. I highly recommend this TV for someone looking for a basic LED HDTV without the smart tv bells and whistles and price. If future buyers also find parts missing out of the box you may want to steer clear unless you plan to wall mount it and use a different remote in which case you probably don't care.TL;DR: It's a great TV worth more than what they're asking. Audio is nothing to get excited for so you may want a soundbar. I had an issue with not enough parts included but everything is fine now. If you're looking for a cheap, large, non-smart TV, this is the TV for you.Update: Customer service was a breeze and the missing parts have been replacedUpdate 2: First was an early Christmas gift for mom. I was so impressed I ordered a second for myself since the price went to $250. This time it came with all the parts and documentation :). Screen and build quality still on par with the first.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Master Yoda
Reviews.Content: This TV is pretty good for the price.What this TV comes with:1080p 60HZ TV ScreenEasy to put together standInstruction manualQuick start guideRemote control with batteries included (AAA)Screw driver to attach the standPinkish screen cleaning clothConnections This TV has:1. Coaxial (Screw type connection)2. Audio In (3.5mm jack used for when you want PC audio)3. VGA Port (Connection used to connect a PC so the TV can be used as a PC Monitor)4. Composite (Connection that uses Yellow cable for Video and Red and White cables for audio)5. Component (Video connection that uses Red, Blue and Green cables)6. 2 HDMI Ports7. 1 HDMI/MHL/Roku Port (Standard HDMI port that also supports hooking up your cellphone and the TV will display what is on your phone as well as recharge your phone. Also supports the Roku Streaming stick.)8. SPDIF (Used for sending out digital audio signals to digital surround receivers.9. Analog Audio Out  (Used for connecting to analog audio receivers)10. Headphone (To attach headphones to the TV)11. USB (Mostly useless.)----USB Supports-2 GB Fat32 and Fat16 flash drivesJPEG Pictures (Baseline only...progressive not supported)MP3 Files (32-48k hz at 32-320Kbps)Video and Audio Settings.The TV includes just basic Video and Audio settings (with some advanced) that you find on most new TVs both cheap and expensive.Video:Various Video ModesBrightnessContrastColorTintSharpnessAdvanced:Dynamic ContrastFilm ModeNoise and Mpeg noise reductionPlus a series of Aspect Ratio settings.Audio:Various Audio Modes (SRS is included)BassTrebleBalanceAdvanced:AVL (Audio leveler to protect against loud commercialsSpeaker (Turns TV speakers on or off)Equalizer (Various bars to change the audio)SRS Settings-Tru Surround HD on or offDialog clarityTrubassDefinitionOverall, nothing fancy or advanced at all for picture or audio settings. Just basic, simple, and easy to use.I've only been watching the TV for a few minutes but the picture seems to be great. Haven't listened to the TV speakers as I use Headphones. Blacks seem to be black and the picture is clear. I've only seen some  720p videos on it so far (Direct TV) and I like the picture a lot.Things and light are reflecting off the screen so it's best to keep light away from the screen. It's best to watch this TV in the dark but it is fine in the light as well. For the price I got this for ($278) I can't complain at all.You can move the TV sideways without having to move the stand. You can't put the TV at an angle though up or down which is a bummer. Still though, my past few TVs with stands couldn't do anything but sit still and do nothing. So the TV being allowed to move at all is a plus.UPDATE:I finally got a blu-ray player even though I have had this TV for a little while.I did the best I could calibrating this as I am not very good at these things.Screen Size: Full 100% (does no cropping of the picture at all)Color Temp: WarmAvanced Picture Settings: All settings Off.Brightness: 51Contrast: 54Color:43Tint: 0Sharpness: 20I did these settings the best I can using the Spears and Munsil calibration Blu-Ray disc.Also, the remote feels really cheap. And sometimes when I click on volume up or down, for unknown reasons it sometimes signals the TV to change to channel 3 or 4. Kind of annoying but doesn't happen too much.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the Money!
Reviews.Author: ECB
Reviews.Content: I received my oCosmo 40" LED TV a couple of days ago. Hooked up the TV today. Outstanding picture! I did not expect this quality from a low cost TV. Sound is pretty good. When you set up the TV, go to "Audio" section and manually set the bass level to +8, and the treble to +3. This seems to be the best sound setting for this TV. Overall, I am very pleased with this TV. I would highly recommend this purchase!!!

Reviews.Title: This TV really turns me on!
Reviews.Author: Five-o
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up Crystal clear picture light weight I was skeptical about this tv thinking you can't get quality for such a low price this tv is better than I've seen at 4 times the price. You won't be sorry if you are thinking of buying one buy it.40 inch LCD TV for less than three hundred dollars sounds kind of like junk but it is not at all junk.

Reviews.Title: Okay for generic TV uses, not for gaming or PCs.
Reviews.Author: Jarred J. Ibarra "Steel hedgehog"
Reviews.Content: It's okay. First and foremost, it's okay. Do not let this deter you from getting this TV. For the price you pay, it's a lot of value and should be treated as such. 90% of the people 90% of the time will look favorably on this TV, not because of how amazing it is, but for how amazing it is for the money you paid. Don't deny it, the reason you're reading these reviews is because you know there MUST be something wrong with this TV for it to be so big and relatively cheap, but you want to know if these yet known flaws outweigh your desire for a big cheap TV or keep you from enjoying it later down the road as your use of it evolves.It's a great TV. Not just for the money, but in general, it is a great TV for the sake of TV. Assuming of course all your delivered content is at 24 frames per second. You can stop reading and buy it now.You want to know more about what is so good about it? Fine, I'll divulge a bit.It has tons of connections. More than I honestly need and will use. It even has VGA so you can use a older PC with it. I'm using Radeon graphics (HD 7870) and have this television hooked up through the HDMI and didn't have to do much at all to get the picture correct and clear, so the connections work well. I've had other (older) LCD TVs require me to dig deep into their settings before I could get them to recognize and display the PC output correctly. I'm not sure how most newer TVs handle that, but this one does it automatically and great. Just be sure to set the Picture setting to "Full 100%" display mode and the picture will fill the screen properly.The stand works properly and allows the TV to pivot so you can get behind it to connect more things. I love that. The power cord is adequately long. Unlike a few reviewers, all of my HDMI ports work. Most people should check all the ports and features of any electronic, name brand or otherwise, to be sure there is no defects. And lucky me, mine is dandy.It's thin and light, it doesn't use a huge amount of power, in fact, before you mess with the picture settings, it starts out with Power Savings mode. Cranking up the brightness will turn up the power usage, but not be a huge amount, in fact I measure it to be only a few extra watts on static images. The sound works well for what it is, it's no home theatre system, but if you're buying a sub-$500 TV, you probably don't care about amazing sound. It's okay, and there is nothing wrong with that. I personally turned the treble up a bit to make voices more distinct and clear.So it's nice. You can buy it now, it's okay, you know you want it.Still here? You want to know why this review isn't 5 out of 5?  Didn't you see everyone else review this thing's amazing display and adequate sound? Fine, I'll tell you my problems with this television, but they won't apply to a lot of you out there so they're not exactly realistic reasons to keep most of you for enjoying this great bargain product.It's the display. I see it in several other reviews. This TV has a GREAT display. They can't believe how good it is, especially for the money. It's got great clarity! It's nice! The colors are so vivid!Sure. Until you hook it up as a PC display. Then you open up a website. Let's say amazon.com. Then you scroll down. Then you see it. THE GHOSTING (dun dun dun?)Ghosting is basically after images from poor response times from the screen or from bad analog signals. Basically, the pixels don't change color fast enough from one color to another and you see a sort of afterimage. This display has TONS of it. Almost all of it from white to another color. It's most noticeable when are scrolling down webpages with black text and multicolored images on white backgrounds. It's not just black, it's reds, pinks, oranges, and browns that leave these trails too. All easily noticeable from 15ft away. Maybe more, but I don't have the space to test it.Blues, greens and yellows are less noticeable, you have to be within 5ft of the screen to notice them and really look for it.Also, skinny black text on a white background seems to have faint yellow highlights, which bugs my eyes quite a lot. I even brought other people in and asked them, "Do you see some of this faint yellow around some of these letters, or am I just crazy?" I got a resounding yes from my volunteers (to seeing the yellow, not to my being crazy). This doesn't happen with thicker, larger or bold text.Most videos on the internet run lower than 30fps to save bandwidth, so Netflix and Hulu are going to display just fine on this TV. I mean, the ghosting is still there, it's just less apparent. I only noticed it when watching vlogs with people with dark rimmed glasses and pasty white faces moved their heads a lot. I doubt you're going to care about a little text and picture trails if you're checking facebook or trolling some forums, this isn't a deal breaker for lot of people. But not me, I like to game on my PC and use Steam's Big Picture Mode. Anything running faster than 24 fps with lots of contrasting color is going to have ghosting and you WILL notice it. An extreme case of this would be Guacamelee. I love that game. It is lots of solid colors and little shading or light effects. There are many portions of the game where your main character will be running quickly against a light background where the ghosting will be VERY apparent. Military shooters with bright skies and lots of cinematic lens flare have tons of ghosting too and motion blur will becomes mildly exaggerated."We get it, you play games, it's not perfect, so what?" It's not only games that I see this being a problem. Just shopping around Amazon.com, I notice products lose detail on this screen when you have two like colors next to each other. That black stitching on those black shoes that is usually obvious? Where the black leather and black breathable mesh meet? Gotta zoom right in on it to see it is even there, otherwise it's just detail-less single black space. The best way I've found to fix this is to turn off the Dynamic Contrast feature, but this leaves more vibrant scenes looking more bland. So depending on the media you're consuming, you're going to have to change the settings. Which brings us to my next complaint.The responsiveness from the TV's menu navigation and remote commands. I can press the buttons for the volume or navigation quickly, but the TV just doesn't respond to the commands quickly. You need the volume down fast, but not muted? Too bad. Holding down the button doesn't help either, it doesn't accelerate after a second or two, same snail pace all the way.  You know where everything is in the menu and want to adjust something quickly? Slowdown, Cowboy, you'll press the buttons faster than the TV will respond. So even if you did want to mess with settings between games for the best picture for a given event, it's going to take patience.I can't judge how a PS3 or Xbox will play on this TV, I don't own them. But from my experience, if you're a gamer with sharp eyes, don't grab this TV and expect to be competitive with ultra-fast response times and clear color contrast. I can only assume when you see that black chopper descending from the sky with that bright lens flare, you're going to see the same ghosting you would see from the PC version of the same game.Also, on bright scenes you will notice the backlighting isn't quite even, with some slight darkness on the left and right edges. I feel like a whiner for saying it, that hardly bugs me like any of the other mentioned problems, but I feel I should say it for completeness sake.See? Doesn't that all seem circumstantial and nit-picky? Think that'll apply to a lot of people? Most casual gamers, children, soccer moms or dads that just want to have a beer and watch the big game won't care about any of the issues I have. I doubt they'll even notice it. Most shows and cartoons have enough difference in color that the lack of contrast won't make you miss any important detail.I'm still trying to convince myself to keep the TV, this is the 2nd one I've had delivered to me. First one had a red stuck pixel, and none of the silly color changing backgrounds I threw at it fixed it. This one has some specks from foreign material getting trapped  inside of it during manufacturing and single stuck grey pixel off in the lower left corner of the screen. Please not that these things happen with ALL TVs regardless of the manufacturer or cost and DOES NOT EFFECT THE RATING OF THIS PRODUCT. All judgements of ghosting and contrast issues were made viewing this TV in both a lighted room and with the lights off.If anyone has any questions or criticisms, free to comment. I am open to answering questions and accept constructive complaints or comments.-EDIT- 12-7-13Another odd flaw has come to my attention. When viewing two different webpages side by side I noticed part of one of the page's design was replicated across the entire screen. To anyone with this TV and a computer, you can replicate this by going to TomsHardware.com and place the browser on the left or right side of the screen. The dotted lines between articles are spread across the entire screen and move as you scroll up and down the page. Once again, if you plan to use this TV as a monitor for a PC, I do not recommend it. I have made this a 2-star review now, the quality of the display is worse than I originally thought. I'm pretty sure I'll find more webpages or scenarios that will expose more flaws in this TV as time passes.

Reviews.Title: I got the last laugh.
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I bought my son this television for Christmas.  He needed a new television for only playing games, so I didn't want to spend a lot.  After reading the reviews, I took the chance and spent the $249 that it was going for at the time.  Well, my nephew....who loves Samsung, and my son's friends, all kind of made a joke out of the oCOSMO brand.  I could tell that my son was even a bit hesitant about hooking it up.  I assured everyone that it would be great.  I got the last laugh when the oCOSMO turned on.  The picture was BEAUTIFUL and SO CLEAR!!!  LOL....My nephew, Mr. 55" SAMSUNG, was speechless!  A few days ago, my nephew asked me to look up this same television, because he is thinking of purchasing one.  :)

Reviews.Title: Great Tv Great Price. Not a fake review.
Reviews.Author: JG
Reviews.Content: I was pretty amazed at how many people insisted I get a name brand TV (easily a couple $100 more) over this one but this is easily one of the best purchases I've ever made. Yes, a little caution had to be thrown in the wind as I'm sure a lot of off brand TVs have left people regretful but this is not one of them.Despite the reviews claiming poor sound and picture, I found it to be quite the opposite. The picture is great after a few tweaks in the settings and the sound is average to above average with a surprising amount of control if you know what your doing. I'm sure there are better TV's out there but this is extremely solid for the price and I'm much happier I didn't waste the extra money for a "name brand".Tested my gaming systems and Blu-Rays and was satisfied with the results too. Soon I will be displaying my Mac on it to see how that goes but I'm sure with the results so far that it will be satisfactory.Don't listen to people that would prefer you buying something more expensive because they bought something more expensive. I can't tell the difference between the $899 TV in our living room and this one.I would buy from ocosmo again.

Reviews.Title: Yikes!
Reviews.Author: Matt Kraus
Reviews.Content: I work in pro AV and look at screens / displays for a living.  Part of my work requires a large monitor, which was the purpose of this purchase - to be able to do a little work from home on weekends without a big price-tag or getting in the way of the family's screen.My expectations were very low for this purchase, primarily because of the $249 price tag.  That's disruptively low for a 40-inch 1080P product.  Although I tend towards Sony and Samsung, I thought "hey, it's Amazon...if it's not worth the rock-bottom price, just return it."At the moment this purchase is still pretty confusing.  Yes, I realize LCD substrate doesn't come from very many places and that other than some of the internals, most LCDs have a lot in common screen-wise.  But this device is over-the-top on features and is picture-wise several orders of light-year ahead of, for example, a Walmart Sanyo, anything made by Element, Westinghouse, pretty much anything by Vizio, and the rest of the low-cost alternative.  It's Korean, which means (although difficult to verify) that the screen probably comes from the joint Samsung/Sony factory.  The LED distribution is very, very even, without the splotching seen so often on low-cost displays.  It has MHL, a very modern capability.  I got a three-year warranty for $20.  Even if it dies after three years and 1 day, that's like $8.50 / month for a what is a pretty good set.  How are the manufacturers achieving this price?  Perhaps sometimes "too good to be true" means I'll have to be wrong today.  A+ purchase.This is the best value monitor I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price.  Not fake review.
Reviews.Author: Kayleigh
Reviews.Content: I just ordered this TV on Friday and it arrived today, Saturday! I just used the free standard shipping and did not expect it to arrive overnight.  Easy to set up, clear and colorful picture, no problem with the sound. I really am happy with this purchase.  If you are looking for a TV to meet your basic needs this is the TV for you.  Also, I want to mention that this isn't a fake review. I had read some comments that people had left saying all the positive reviews must be fake.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Missie Ricker
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV for the kids gaming system they are getting for Christmas.  I ordered it a few weeks early so if it wasn't worth the $280 we could send it back and I would still had time to buy something else.  Just opened it today and it was very nice.  Picture quality is great.  It equals TVs priced $150 - $200 more than this one.  It is very easy to attach to the base, attach four screws with the included screw driver and you're done.  Considering the TV has the 3 HDMI ports and it being Roku ready it seems like a great TV for the money.  If I decide to spend the extra $60 ($10 coupon code came with the TV). It will be like having a smart TV for hundreds less.The only things to mention is the remote is very cheap and the sound quality isn't that great.  Both work fine but they are a few steps below the high picture quality.If we ever add TVs to the bedrooms I will look for oCOSMO brand.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful. Stunning. AMAZING TV!
Reviews.Author: hb "Holdyn b."
Reviews.Content: If you are like me then you love electronics and love them even more when they are sold at a great price. You might also really have a high sense of brand loyalty because let's face it, it is your money and you want only the best and what has earned your trust and consumer interests. I was skeptical of this TV because of the brand, it is oCosmo and it is not that popular and definitely not as popular as Samsung, SOny, LG and other industry titans.HOWEVER, THIS TV IS AMAZING!!!! I paid 249.00 for it During Black Friday and it is EVEN BETTER THAN MY LG FLAT SCREEN WHICH COST about $150 MORE! It is stunning, looks like it is really well made and more importantly has excellent sound and picture! THE ADDED FEATURES REALLY MAKE THIS TV WORTH IT ALL!I HONESTLY FEEL LIKE I GOT THIS TV AS A STEAL because it is sooooo good! I JUST CANT BELIEVE WHAT I PAID FOR MY 32 inch LG when a product like this exists and for SO MUCH LESS! the screen is true 40 inch so it looks fully and large and the shipment came with everything EVEN a screwdriver! PUT IT together in minutes.I AM SO HAPPY I GOT THIS AND I HIGHLY, HIGHLY encourage you to give it a try DO NOT simply discount it becuase oCosmo isn't that popular YET!!! IT IS PACKED WITH FEATURES and is SIMPLY AN AMAZING TV!YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED. NEEDLESS TO SAY, I also purchased the 3 year protection plan and I feel confident and happy that all well go well.BTW I have the ROKU streaming stick since it is ROKU ready and I JUST LOVE IT!GREAT LUCK! BUY THIS TV as a gift, for yourself, LIVING ROOM. it is so beautiful I am sure your guests will be so impressed, you definitely will be!

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture
Reviews.Author: Laserjock "Chris"
Reviews.Content: Received this TV last night.Installed stand and set up using the Spears & Munsil BluRay disc.I am truly amazed at the quality of the picture. This will go in daughter's bedroom so not a critical viewing setup by any means but it is definitely a good looking picture.I wouldn't hesitate to purchase a second unit if needed.

Reviews.Title: Amazing 40"
Reviews.Author: Chris Robles
Reviews.Content: This tv is great! I love it its clear sound good and i got 2 days early! Its pretty big and its really light. I saved alot of cash on this tv. Dont listen to the bad reviews its a good but and i recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good tv for $249
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Williams
Reviews.Content: I've only had it about a week now and will update if any issues arise. I know most people are skeptical about a brand no one has heard of, but I say go for it especially if you like nicer things but on a budget. Admittedly, I was disappointed once I set the tv up, the picture and sound was horrible, but work with it. It got better. And now I love my tv.Pros:Great size, very thin and pretty lightweightEasy to assemble the platformPicture quality is OK once you tweak it to your likingsSound quality is OK once tweaking that as well (turn off the AVL bc it just creates background noise)Have not tried the HDMI ports, but the USB works fineCame with all needed components and nothing was damagedIt swivels enough to adjust to the angle you wantNo glare problemCheap but not low qualityCons:Takes a lot of adjusting to get the picture/sound you wantStill, the picture is not as vibrant as shown on the box or on here; looks like your average tv but the HD channels are betterCannot program tv to Comcast cable remote; unknown brand so you have to use the tv remote for power/volumeTips:*Turn off the AVL, because it just creates background noise (Thanks Amazon tech support)**I set my picture to these settings: 30 brightness, 80 contrast, 50 color, 0 tint, 50 sharpness, turned off dynamic contrast and chose the warm color temperature***To assemble, I placed the screen on my satin pillowcase to avoid scratching, but oils from my hair that were on my pillowcase created a lot of smudges on the screen. The cloth the tv came with did zero justice to clean it, so just know it is safe to use a microfiber (nothing fancy, mine was from Dollar Tree) cloth to clean the screen. I wet my hand and sprinkled the water onto the microfiber cloth (don't soak it) and wiped the oil smudges away without ruining the screen. I then used the cloth it came with to eliminate the streaks****I don't like sleeping in the dark, so the power save mode is a quick way to dim the tv for bedtime so it doesn't be uber bright (just hit picture on your remote til it says power save)

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: William Stallings
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a larger tv and really didn't want or need to spend a lot of money on it. Saw this tv and the price really caught my eye. Read the reviews and thought I would take a chance. I ordered it on Saturday for $249 and received it on Monday. Hooked it up last night and while there may be "better" units available, I don't think you will be disappointed with it. Time will tell as far as the reliability but for now I'm very pleased with my choice. I gave it 5 stars not because it's this best tv but because of what your getting for the money.

Reviews.Title: Don't listen to these idiots!!
Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: Packaging: This is an amazing television. I received it with nothing missing or damaged at all. I opened it and placed the stand and it worked.Sound: First of all the sound is pretty great. Once you tune it like I did you can it is not that bad, though I use it with my Logitech Speakers.Screen: It is amazing!! First thing you must do to any television is to tune it until it looks awesome like this one!! This is  the best television I have owned. I strongly advise you to change the settings until you like them because factory settings look horrible, don't listen to these negative reviews this is a must buy!!TV DISPLAYDimension: 36.60" x 8.66" x 23.81" (with stand)  36.60" x 8.66" x 21.60" (without stand)Weight: 19.27 lb (with stand)  17.68 (without stand)Power Input: 100-240VAC, 60/50 Hz, 3A (MAX.) 61w typical 72w (MAX.)Resolution: (1920 x 1080) = Full High DefinitionResponse Time = 8ms(I will post pictures soon)

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: Adam Sanft
Reviews.Content: For the price this TV is legit.  Have had it for a month now.  The picture is not the quality you'd get with a $500 or $600 tv, but its pretty close.  So far it functions perfectly and has a nice enough picture that you'd never guess it was a cheap TV.  We hooked up a ROKU stick and it works great as well.  Very satisfied with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price!
Reviews.Author: T. Barnett "T. Barnett"
Reviews.Content: Great picture and sound, but playing at very low volume, the automatic volume dampener adjusts the sound too low to hear very well until it slowly adjusts itself to normal. I will get to test it better when Sunday football comes this weekend since I've only had it less than 1 week. Other than that it's a great TV for the price. It swivels left and right at about 45 degrees each direction without moving the base, so the base remains straight and stationary. Great shipping time of just 2 days, and I chose the slowest, cheapest shipping too. It even came with a small phillips screwdriver to attach the base parts, which is an alright gift and OK for small jobs, but is way too small for the size of the hardened screws provided - so you'll need your own.You also can't beat Amazon's careful and neat packaging of the products they ship.You can't beat Amazon's price on a this 40" TV, and this is the second TV I've purchased from Amazon or online, all with no hassles or lemons, which makes the whole shopping online thing a great experience.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great gift
Reviews.Author: John "coffeelover51"
Reviews.Content: I sent this as a gift to my daughter and son-in-law and they are ecstatic with it.  My daughter loves movies and says the picture is outstanding.  She also loves the compact size which made it very easy to setup in their small living room.  My son-in-law is more interested in gaming and he loves it as well.The sound seems fine for them, they have it set at 22 out of 100 and report it's very good (this may be due to the small room it's in).I don't usually buy extended warrantees but I did in this case since it is a new brand.All in all a great gifting experience at a really low price.By the way, I ordered at $278 and when the price dropped to $249 Amazon quickly refunded the difference

Reviews.Title: Great TV. Great price
Reviews.Author: william reed
Reviews.Content: Just received my oCosomo 40 inch TV. Cost- $278.00.  Easy set up. Great picture. Smashing sound. What a bargain. I am not a TV nerd, but this looks great to me. Incredible price. Love it. Buy it.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: This is a really good looking display for the price.. I tried to take some pictures to share, but the camera on my phone doesn't do it justice.The White's and blacks and blacks are really good, even high and low light detail are passable. Colors are also really nice, but they are a little over saturated out of the box. (reds a little more so) But that was easily corrected.The speakers are even pretty good. Not tinny like you might expect with a lower priced brand.The viewing angle is also really good and even.. bare lose any quality from extreme angles.The case is actually attractive and the swivel base is nice and surprisingly sturdy.That said, there are some slight but negligible shortfalls.When the screen is mostly black, the blacks aren't really even. Not edge light leakage like older LCDs but just a bit splotchy.The other issue is the response time. On the website is says 8ms, but I'm guessing this is a grey-to-grey. There is some motions blur, but not much.So far, I've only used the hdmi inputs and the s/pdif output.Overall really happy with the purchase, but I've only had it a couple days.. I'll update after I've had it a while or if anything changes.

Reviews.Title: perfect buy
Reviews.Author: Dhaval Shah
Reviews.Content: This might seem like it is a cheap television and hence might not be good quality, but I am completely surprised to find it's an amazing TV. Don't go for the brand name, and save some money for a really high quality TV watching experience.

Reviews.Title: What a Deal!
Reviews.Author: Jason H "risen_sun86"
Reviews.Content: Got this after reading some reviews, the only turnoff i had prior to buying it was the Energy Savings thing listed it as - $16 a year, which is pretty high compared to other t.v.s this size(40" t.v.s usually run about $12, $13 a year.. i know not much difference, but..)  Anyway, i got the t.v. and was ecstatic to see the t.v. is only $12.3 a year.  There was a wrong description on the buyer page.Now to the t.v. itself, it looks amazing.  The picture quality is comparable to any brand name t.v. i have ever seen, along with great audio.  The controller and setup is pretty easy to figure out.  Very  very pleased with this buy, would recommend!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Not just awesome for the price, its an excellent TV.  I got it when it was $250 with a 3 year warranty for like $20 extra. I use it for PS3 Gaming and Netflix. The volume controls sometimes get burned into the TV, but goes away when you turn it off. Beautiful design with a super thin bezel, and its super light which is helpful. I could lift it with no help whatsoever, and it will be very easy to transport next time I move. As a 130lb female thats an important factor to me. The picture quality is great. Good as your gonna get for paying less than like $1000. If you watch HD programming you'll have no complaints. I've used it for 4 months at this point.

Reviews.Title: Great Price, Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Grady Diesslin
Reviews.Content: Have had it running daily for the past month or so, no problems with programming a universal remote or hooking up the PC to the TV.  For the price, you can't beat this TV.

Reviews.Title: Would recommend to friends
Reviews.Author: Johanna
Reviews.Content: Great buy for the money. Picture and sound really good. Looks very sleek and easy to install. Easy instructions on programming.

Reviews.Title: Buy it
Reviews.Author: Wendy Roque
Reviews.Content: This television far exceeded my expectations. I was hesitant because it wasn't a brand I knew and the price was so cheap. Don't hesitate, the quality is equal to the name brand televisions  in a higher price category.

Reviews.Title: A Very Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We were in the market for a new TV and after doing a little shopping we came across the oCosmo 40-inch on Amazon. Though we were skeptical because it was a no-name TV and inexpensive, we purchased, anyhow.Without going into great detail, (it was expressed in other reviews) this is a fine TV that fits our needs. We are not gamers, and could care less about high fidelity audio. The audio of this unit is perfect for us.Thank you oCosmo and Amazon.I notice that the price has gone up since we bought (when the TV is available). Not surprised

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: My ps4 works great with it, lightweight, and great picture. I love the rotating base. Sound is also really good.

Reviews.Title: Our 40" Ocosmo TV(s)
Reviews.Author: Mark In NV "Nevada Amazon user"
Reviews.Content: We started out ordering a 40" Ocosmo brand TV that We had never heard of, because of the good price.  After receiving it, seeing the picture, hearing the sound, and setting up the Roku stick we had ordered with it - We ended up ordering (2) more of the same 40" TVs and our son ordered one too.

Reviews.Title: Like finding money in your coat pocket from last year, Lucky!
Reviews.Author: Richard Wagner
Reviews.Content: This TV is so amazing for the price you will feel guilty about how little the workers making it must be earning. If you can deal with that (and guess I will have to learn to) then ... WOW, it will be the best purchase you'll make this year. By the way, the sound is fine and everything was in the box. It was delivered so quickly I think it must have come by ambulance.I rarely have good luck like this so I'm sort of expecting it to soon burn my house down and I'll let you know soon, but I sure hope not!Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: INCREDIBLE VALUE for the $$$$!!!
Reviews.Author: R.H.
Reviews.Content: I was needing a larger TV for our living room to replace our smaller 32" Panasonic, and this oCOSMO seemed to fill the bill.  I was a bit hesitant to order an "off brand" tv, especially one that was just introduced this year, but knowing Amazon's great return policy I figured this purchase would be safe enough.  And, for all the conspiracy theorists out there, I do not work for oCOSMO or AMAZON, so this is a sure-nuff review!  The tv came in great condition in 3 days, and the box was intact.  The TV was packed well inside and floated amongst four high-density foam corner blocks, with about 3" of open space on the face and back, so short of a fork lift impalement or crushing incident, this seems to be a very secure boxing type.  All the listed accessories were intact, and immediately I noticed the instruction book was printed on nice glossy paper with full color illustrations (classy!)and it was fairly easy to understand and very complete.  I had the tv set up and ready to go in under 5 minutes, including assembly of the swivel base (a small but functional screwdriver was included!).  The picture was VERY nice right out of the box, but of course I had to do some small amount of tweeking to the settings in the menu to get it "just right".  Seems to have plenty of color saturation, a very sharp display, and plenty of room left for adjusting the tint, color, contrast, etc.  The 1080i was especially sharp on my OTA (over-the-air) stations. Be advised, this set features an "Energy Saving" video setting as default from the factory, so if you want a brighter display turn off this setting first thing. The viewing angle is somewhat narrow, which is troubling.  The picture washes out when you move a few degree to either side of looking straight at it, and the tint and contract really change.  Now, I've heard better sound, as it's barely acceptable for us in the living room.  Our smaller Panasonic actually has far better sound, just fuller and richer, so this may be a problem unless you have a sound bar.  With the bass turned almost wide open on this model, even with TruSurround turned on, it was very mid-range heavy and sounded like it was coming from a tin can.  Fortunately, the menu also includes a nice graphic EQ that you can mess with, but all in all the sound is pathetic on this model. We may invest in a sound bar at some point down the road, but it will have to do for now. Please note: This set sadly does NOT include a "Signal Meter" function in the menu, which is very handy for OTA broadcasts.  It does, however, include a "Guide" button on the remote which displays the program information, title, content, etc. for the current program while using for OTA broadcasts.  The remote is well laid-out, logical, and even has a section for a ROKU stick if you want to watch streaming video, as this TV is "Roku-ready", which is nice. The remote is fairly weak, though, and you need to point it directly at the sensor.  Another negative that I will mention - - the tuner in this set is not as sensitive as my old Panasonic for some OTA stations - - a couple of them break up more often, although I have a steady 75% signal on those particular ones, with 100% on all the others.  The oCOSMO instruction manual states that your OTA signal should not fall below 65%, which is a bit odd as I had a few stations that never gave any problems on my Panasonic that were around 50%.  I have a very small RCA in the bedroom that does the same exact thing as this oCOSMO, while the Panasonic does not.  Just a little frustrating, and while not a deal breaker by any means, I had to deduct a star for this shortcoming.  Not a big deal if you don't watch a lot of OTA broadcasts. Obviously there is a bit of weakness in these sets in their power to draw in weaker OTA stations, as compared to the high-dollar TV's out there with more powerful and sensitive tuners.  Bottom line - - this set seems to be of a nice quality, not super fancy, but good for the $$$.  It's lightweight and runs fairly cool, which is good, too.  It's one of the best bargains in electronics that I've ever made, and that's saying a lot!  I come from a background in electronics, with my dad being from the old school of radio & TV repair, and I'm very familiar with all the many brands of electronics and their makers.  This particular TV has several "interesting" qualities - - it's remote codes are for SONY - - and it's menu display is the same as RCA.  My smaller RCA has an identical menu, so oCOSMO seems to be a major manufacturer of components used by other manufacturers who has decided to make their own brand of TV.  I also know that Sceptre is another brand that these folks make, their 39" model  being almost identical to this one.  Nevertheless, the reliability of these sets is yet to be established, but there's nothing at this point to indicate that they won't be as reliable and long-lasting as the next brand from Asia.  Needless to say, I'm very impressed with oCOSMO and hope this TV lasts for a several years.  I did purchase the 3-year warranty, just in case.  In short, this TV is quite a BARGAIN and we like it. Well done, AMAZON!!UPDATE: After using this set for almost two months now, it seems to be holding up great. But, I am not as enthusiastic with the picture quality,  the limited angle of view is very troublesome, and the overall quality of the picture is a bit lacking, even after much adjustment of the settings in almost every conceivable combination. Additionally, I will stand by my initial critique of the sound quality of this TV - - it's just horrendous.  Obviously, most of the excessive mid-range and rattling of the speakers comes from the ultra-thin design, and is common among any TV of this design - - some are even worse, so it is what it is.  Another very obvious flaw in the sound that I didn't mention earlier - - when you turn it down to 1 it is still FAR too loud (roughly equal to the 7 setting on my Panasonic) which makes it tough to watch late at night when you don't want to disturb others.  I've found if I disable the TruSurround mode it will lower the sound, which helps, but still it's just too loud on it's lowest setting. In desperation, I connected the TV audio outputs to my AV receiver and it helped (of course), but still the quality of the sound is just much too thin and mid-range heavy (seems to be coming from the TV's own amp). Our old smaller Panasonic had superior sound and picture quality overall, and unfortunately I'm forced to take this new oCOSMO TV to the bedroom and bring our old Panasonic back to the living room.  The sound quality issues, along with the somewhat narrow viewing angle and lackluster picture just isn't going to allow it's continued use as our main TV.  However, you have to remember the price I paid for this thing, which is still remarkable for what we got.  I am now considering a new 40" set with a more proven track record, such as a Samsung brand.  While the price is somewhat more, the difference in overall quality in picture and sound is not even close, and anyone who honestly can say they are the same is only fooling themselves. This oCOSMO TV is great for the price, a good bedroom or spare TV, but for a main set there are much better options out there - - in this case you get what you pay for, but not much else.

Reviews.Title: Decent product at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Came in good working order. The documentation was minimal but clear enough.Pros: Good picture. Acceptable built in sound. Enough inputs. The Roku buttons on the remove can be setup to run an AppleTV.  Light, and mounted on wall bracket easily.Cons: Build quality just okay. A bit "plasticky" overall.  The power cord is not long and is not detachable which meant I had to get a bit more creative then prior TV to run it in the wall.  All of the inputs are rather closely packed so had to replace a cable with larger plug.Overall very happy with the unit for the price. Hopefully it will hold up with time.

Reviews.Title: great tv for price
Reviews.Author: cris
Reviews.Content: So, got tv few days ago. The image quality is very good for the price.. maybe not the best.. but for this price I honestly dont think u can get better. In.my opinion I has better picture quality than the other non name brand tvs. It has better quality than my LG .and that's speaking some praise. Very easy to set up and it came fully intact. I bought it to use in my room for my ps4.  Gameslook great.. I mainly play Battle field 4 and it looks amazing! Input lag wise.. it's hard to tell because the game unfortunately has many issues.. everything else games , blurays look awesome! I give it a 4 because for the price u can't beat it. If anyone is wondering about brand.. seems it's tied to spectre. There are artixles stating this ans how this is new " higher quality" brand for that company.. honestly, is buy again.. Ima gonna give it a few weeks . If it holds up. I will purchase the 47' that just went on amazon for like $330.00 or so.. forget exact price. Not a bad buy at all.. w I'll give 5 stars if it holds up farther down the road.

Reviews.Title: OCOSMO meets expectations!
Reviews.Author: Deborah L. Cormier
Reviews.Content: I recently received my OCOSMO 40-inch and absolutely love it! It has great sound and picture. Was easy to set up (very important!) and is ROKU ready!  I wasn't sure if I really wanted/needed a large screen such as this, however, it is absolutely awesome and I'm very happy I purchased it. I only have one question...why does the OCOSMO logo show up on the screen (for a few seconds) each and every time you turn it on?

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: Although it is easy to be skeptical to see this tv at such a low price, I can easily say that I was very much satisfied with this tv. Picture quality is great, and the tv itself is very sleek and pretty looking. Where the tv lacks is in its sound quality, you are going to need to have a separate sound bar or other types of sound system if you want high quality sound. But still well worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: Really Not Bad At All
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey Heilpern
Reviews.Content: I am definitely not an expert on TVs.  Took a chance on this very reasonable TV based on the fact that I believe 4K will be something in the medium term future and I couldn't justify purchasing an expensive TV now when we'll all likely be upgrading in the next 4 - 5 years.  Instead I bought this for $278 and a 4 year Square Trade warranty for $36.  So far it seems like I made the right decision.  The unboxing was pretty painless - I mean this is definitely a no-name brand so no pretty marketing materials, etc but everything that was needed was there.  The stand is fine - cheap but fine.  I used an electric screw driver which seemed to do the trick on making sure it wasn't to wobbly.  The remote is sufficient, but I quickly programmed all the settings on my Logitech Harmony One remote so I won't be using it going forward.  The picture, as with most TVs, was not great out of the box, but after some tweaking...it seems more than sufficient for the average TV viewer.  Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Blu-Ray Discs, Cable all seem to be pretty good.  My opinion is that this is on par with any other sub $400 40 inch LED.  I haven't tried the speaker so I can't comment on them.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: Kosta
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I got this TV a few days ago. My review till now, the packaging and assembling part were quite easy. The picture quality for standard cable channels is very poor, colors just bad. But, for digital (HD) channels the quality is outstanding, very clear picture, great colors, same for the movies that I'm watching from PC at 720p and 1080p quality.  Another point worth to mention, the build in equalizer doesn't offer too many choices. I've purchased 3 year SquareTrade warranty for $20, so the next three years I'm covered.To sum up, for an average user like me, that almost don't watch standard cable channels, this is a really good buy. If I'll find something else, I'll update my feedback, since I found very interesting discussions going on about this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: P. Mills
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to order this because of the review that suggested the good reviews might be fakes. I can with full certinty say that they are not! I went a head and orded this TV and am very happy that I did. The picture is clear and colors are bright. It's in a beautiful frame and there's even a hook up for my PC. I suppose if you want to play games on it you might want a higher rate then 60Hz but I do not. This TV was a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Price is Right TV
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at how simple it was to put together and it automatically began setting up.  AWESOME picture quality and am surprised how good the sound is.Day Two:  I've got the FAV circle popping up in the middle of the screen all the time.  So I add a favorite channel like its asking and then the FAV channel bleeps the station like its constantly trying to change the channel...annoying.  I'll be calling the company ASAP today.  I'll leave my answer to product value up to how they fix this problem.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: jp2012
Reviews.Content: This TV is great! My wife and I wanted a slightly larger TV for our bedroom than the one we had and started shopping for something that looked good but was affordable. If money was not an issue and I had some to burn than I probably would have gotten a different TV but we were looking at spending around $300 max. Ideally we wanted a 40-42" for the space in our room. This is the only TV in that size that was in the price range we wanted to stay in. I was skeptical at first. It was a brand I had never heard of and with it being so cheap there had to be a catch. Upon arrival I opened it up and was immediately impressed with the physical appearance of the TV. It was light but did not feel lacking in quality by any means. The important part is the picture. I became even more impressed when I finally got it hooked up. I mounted it to the wall and have a Sony blu-ray player attached to it. The picture is great! The processor has handled every movie we watched great ( I watched Avatar on it for the initial trial run) and netflix looks awesome as well. For the videophiles in the world the screen is not going to be mind-blowing but it looks really good. The one thing I have noticed is when its an all black scene or fade out you can see where the black pixels are inconsistent in the depth of their color. This happens rarely and has never been an issue watching anything on it though. For the price you will NOT find a better TV. Some people are concerned with the name of the products they have in their house which is fine and understandable but in this case we definitely made the correct choice. With the low price we were even able to add on the additional 3 year warranty for piece of mind and still were below our $300 budget. I have told everyone I know about these TV's and the people that have seen it in action are impressed as well. I always tell them the price after I've shown them and they can't believe it. Many have gotten one themselves afterwords. I would strongly recommend this TV for anyone who is price conscience but still wants a great product.

Reviews.Title: Irish Customer
Reviews.Author: Eoghan O'Connor
Reviews.Content: Even though it had to cross the Atlantic to get to me it was in great condition, worked fine, unbelievable value I bought it when it was at 190 bucks even with shipping it was cheaper than buying one over here. it has a lot of inputs so its very practical.Just an awesome job all round. Ive had it since Christmas 2013 till present (April 2014).on a side note its extremely light......

Reviews.Title: AMAZING PICTURE
Reviews.Author: NicoletteCipollone
Reviews.Content: THE QUALITY OF THIS TELEVISION IS STRIKINGLY CRYSTAL CLEAR. THE SET IS VERY LIGHT AND SHEEK. LOVE THIS PURCHASE VERY PLEASED

Reviews.Title: great set
Reviews.Author: Jayda Bowden
Reviews.Content: Does everything we need and does it well.  Would consider another anytime we were looking for a tv.  Easy to set up and use

Reviews.Title: Excellent and inexpensive!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: When I was looking to finally buy an HD LED TV to replace my giant old CRT, my brother helped me find this one. He reads a lot of reviews and was actually a little skeptical for a while because there were not as many reviews as some other brands. But the reviews we did find said the picture quality was great and it was worth far more than the low $250 it was going for. I would like to echo those reviews and destroy any doubt that may be lingering in your mind. This was a fantastic purchase. And for those who are afraid that I was paid to write this review, I can assure you, I was not. After many weeks of using this fantastic TV the only issue I have had is that once in a blue moon the picture will flash quickly off and then back on saying something about HDMI. This might be due to a bad HDMI cable or a bad port. Since there is another port I will check that one and update my review. It happens so rarely and for such a short moment that it doesn't bother me hardly at all. Anyhow, I will let you know. In the mean time, buy this TV. Awesomeness.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive, but does the job.
Reviews.Author: HaroldC "Harold L Cloninger"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had any problems with this TV. It's constantly on when we're home.  Like other TV's the speakers aren't the best, but the picture is fine.

Reviews.Title: Don't hate on a brand if you haven't owned it
Reviews.Author: tengleha
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about this TV because there were not a lot of reviews but the reviews of verified Amazon purchases were very good.  I also read a couple of expert reviews about the TV and found that it actually has great picture quality.  The only complaint is around the remote feeling cheap and spongy but if you worry about that as a primary reason for purchasing a TV then that's your preference.  For me, the remote isn't a big deal.  Of course, the purchase for me also was a little less risky as I bought this to use for an arcade and PS3/4 TV in my game room.  When I received the TV, I was very skeptical but we had it hooked up to a PS3 (arcade system hadn't arrived yet) and the picture quality was excellent.  The black is very bright and the colors really pop.  I now have it hooked up to the arcade and it is great.  You can play 80s arcade games, Sega, Atari, PS3 or PS4 and the game display is way above my expectations for a TV in this price range.  I was looking at being under $600 for a 40" TV but to come in at $277 was definitely a pipe dream.  Would recommend this TV to anyone who isn't hung up on having a brand name and if you are worried about it, then add a Square Trade warranty.  You will still save significant $ and who doesn't like saving $.

Reviews.Title: Great color
Reviews.Author: robert j albrecht
Reviews.Content: I am a photographer and I am using this oCOSMO as my monitor for my computer. I find that the whites are pure white and the blacks are pure black the color is outstanding, Using the in photoshop has been a great benefit in editing. I really enjoy the fact that I can switch from computer to TV and watch my TV shows in HD. I am well pleased and would recommend this to any one looking for a HD TV or a monitor.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Mamap "Mamap"
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV I have ever owned. The price and picture makes this an excellent choice for any room in one's home. The sound is great also. Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Rhill65
Reviews.Content: I took a chance on this off-brand with only one review to go on, and I have been nothing but please with it. I use an HDMI cable to hook in my blu-ray player and it works wonderfully! Couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the price
Reviews.Author: ScottinNazareth
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my mom who is not into Smart TV or using it as a monitor or video display.  She runs cable TV through it and tells me constantly how great the picture is.  It's got good sound and is a great TV for the money.

Reviews.Title: Black Friday deal works out great!
Reviews.Author: Giovanni D. Martello
Reviews.Content: This TV is currently in my 9 year old son's game room and is connected to his Wii-U. He watches Netflix and Youtube and also plays games on it. It looks great and is extremely light. If you can get it for a good price like we did I would definitely recommend. The only downside is the Wii-U doesn't recognize this Brand (oCosmo) and won't let you control the TV from the Wii-U remote. Other than that we have had no issues and the picture is great.

Reviews.Title: ocosmo 42" tv
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: I only had it 2 months, . When it was delivered, there were missing parts in the stand. I had to contact ocosmo to send the missing parts and they did. Now I like it and the tv is good so far

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Townley
Reviews.Content: GREAT price, haven't had a single problem. I was a little worried since it was quite a bit cheaper than most other 40'' tvs I had seen, and I hadn't heard of the brand. But I love it. It's a little hard to plug and unplug devices since it is very thin/close to the wall, but that's no issue at all. Would absolutely buy again.One note: Sound quality is only slightly better than what you'd expect, so go for a sound bar as well if you feel like that would be important to you.

Reviews.Title: I am happy with this
Reviews.Author: Cdunn8888
Reviews.Content: The picture is good and don't have any real problem with the TV.  The only small problem is the volume does not go as low as I would like it.  Volume level 1 is still pretty loud.  If they could have put more resolution on the volume i'd have given this 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Works great, looks great
Reviews.Author: George Adkins
Reviews.Content: The TV is as advertised and works great.  I sought out the lowest price on the last couple of TV's I've bought.  This time the OCosmo was it.  My reasoning is that they all made by the same handful of manufacturers and with the more expensive units you're just paying for the name ( I.e. Sony). and this unit was it.

Reviews.Title: oCOSMO 40-inch 1080p 60Hz LED MHL Review
Reviews.Author: Daniel Garza, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because of its price and I got more than I bargained for. The clarity of this picture and the delivery of the sound makes this TV an outstanding buy. I recommend this TV for anyone looking at price and quality.

Reviews.Title: Worth the money
Reviews.Author: sqwirk
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a black Friday deal and it was quite the steal. I was worried since I've never heard of oCOSMO before but it has a warranty and that's what's important when push comes to shove. It was relatively easy to set up, though I wish I had someone to help me when putting the base on. The picture comes in clear and vividly but often times seems cut off on the left and right side of the screen, it's as though I can't find an aspect ratio that actually shows me the entire frame of whatever it is I'm viewing and not have the picture be distorted. This is a minor detail, however, and you do get what you pay for. While I'm pleased with my purchase, the next time I buy a TV I'll save up for a nicer one. I'm a college student on a budget and didn't have a television so this was perfect for me.Pros:-Very good price for what you get-Easy to start watching TV right out of the boxCons:-It wobbles if you knock into it while it's on the base, but is fine when left alone-Volume could have a better range when it comes to loudness. 0 to 1 is a big jump

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the money, despite a few nitpicks
Reviews.Author: Aidian Holder
Reviews.Content: As far as disposable electronics manufactured in China by exploited peasants, child labor and political prisoners go, this is the bomb.  Very solid television for dirt cheap -- lots of connection options, good color reproduction, all that jazz.My only nitpick is the MHL enabled HDMI connector loses video signal after a while watching.  I didn't notice until too late to return the TV, and I'm not sure I would have even if I had noticed it earlier -- there are still two more HDMI connectors that don't have the problem, which is more than I'll need.No idea how it'll stand up over the long term -- my last tv lasted six+ years, and this one seems to have better build quality.  For right now at least I can watch my favorite shows to take my mind off how I contributed to the destruction of the American industrial base and middle class lifestyle by buying this cheap Chinese television.  Hurrah!Update: Problems with the MHL enabled HDMI connector were on my end.  Fixed.

Reviews.Title: By Far the best deal out there!
Reviews.Author: Casey Holcombe
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a birthday present for myself, and I have to say. I am amazingly surprised by it! I just have my gaming system hooked up to it and I also watch Netflix with it, and use it as a monitor for my lap top when watching back videos I edit. The sound is a bit "tinny" for my taste, so I have it hooked up to speakers.

Reviews.Title: An Easy choice
Reviews.Author: Not the best not the worst Fernando Sanchez
Reviews.Content: I'm one of those geeky guys in the family that everyone asks to fix there computers or choosing a tablet or asking if this is a good price for a tv. And I cant lie I do research everything online and on store to get the best price and quality for any electronics. And I highly recommend this tv for up to 300$ but I bought mine at 250 here at amazon :)

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Gus
Reviews.Content: This TV is great for the price that I paid. It has great picture quality. The one thing that I have noticed is that there are those horizontal lines that keep going up and up on the TV. This is just a minor detail that I noticed but it does not really bother me. I additionally got the insurance/protection plant in case anything happens to it. I'm satisfied with this TV for the price that I paid.

Reviews.Title: oCOSMO 40" HDTV
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: I was so lucky to get the greatest buy ever on Cyber Monday. You might think that because this is a relatively unknown brand (new) and that it sold for a comparatively low price that the quality would be lacking. But you would be wrong! The picture is great--vibrant colors, clear. Best is the great sound. This TV is easy to operate and comes with pretty good instructions, also there is phone assistance if needed. This TV is Roku ready. I already had a Roku box so didn't deal with that, but might later with the small thumb-drive like thing that fits into a TV slot and saves you all the wires. Everything worked perfectly, all the controls and the remote, etc. You can plug in your smart phone, which I have not done yet. Can plug in my laptop too, which is fun. I don't subscribe to cable TV so those features are great for streaming. I highly recommend this company and this TV.

Reviews.Title: hidden gem right here
Reviews.Author: Ashley Roseberry
Reviews.Content: wasn't sure bc of the brand but this TV ROCKS!!! picture is better than any Vizio i have owned, so light easy to mount, sits on a dresser in one room and is super sturdy on the stand. I bought them as a gift for my boyfriend, and one for his teenage son. you would think i paid $1000 for one of them. they think I'm the best, now I WANT ONE LOL!!!

Reviews.Title: UH-mazing
Reviews.Author: patriot375
Reviews.Content: Got it for our bedroom as a Christmas present for my wife.  I paid lower for this than most 32" TV's and it-is-amazing.  The picture just pops.  It's january now and almost every day when we get in bed my wife just says to herself "Look at that picture!" ....score :).  It has roku and soundbar buttons (IF you buy an oCosmo soundbar only I think) built on the remote.  The TV tuner is very good too.  Thin, light.  IF there is 1 drawback I would say the sound-nothing too bad, I mean we listen to it every night...I guess-when I see a picture that good I expect to hear surround sound or something.  I would say the sound is definitely better than the sony crt flat "screen" we replaced.  Easily able to be beefed up in this day and age for cheap-Like I said, the sound is not awful or anything just...standard.  I would buy another one of these in a HEARTBEAT.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Terri L Bornick
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter to take to college and it's perfect.  She's happy and so am I with the price.

Reviews.Title: Take a chance on this TV - you won't regret it.
Reviews.Author: Pat T. Bretheim
Reviews.Content: This is the best purchase I've made this year.  I just can't believe that I could get such a great TV for less than $300!  The picture is crisp and clear, the color is vivid and well-balanced, and it easily compares with TVs that sell at 2-3 times the price.  The instructions for assembling the neck were confusing to me, so I just ignored them and it was easy to assemble just by looking at it and figuring it out.  I don't know how the sound is because I bought a sound bar to go with it and use that exclusively, since I listen to music with the TV most of the day.  The remote control is easy to use.We also have a huge Sony TV that we use for movies and TiVo, but when I come back to this TV I am again amazed at the excellent picture quality.  I didn't even make any adjustments - all I did was plug it in!  It is so good that I can't think of any adjustments that I would want to make!  This is true value in a TV.  Definitely worth taking a chance on the oCOSMO!

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good
Reviews.Author: Bingmanson
Reviews.Content: Picked this bad boy up on cyber Monday this year (2013). Like many others, I was very skeptical of a tv this size being sold for such a low price. I looked around at forums and couldn't find anything conclusive that said this was a bad idea, so I pulled the trigger and bought one.I'm very happy with the turn out! Picture quality, while not stunning, is remarkably good. Someone else said their sound was too low, but I actually have the opposite problem. While watching at night, I need to turn my volume down to 1, and even then it's still a little loud. My Xbox One is very happy with this tv, and so am I.

Reviews.Title: A Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Father Of Two Girls
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV at a good price. The only down side is that the sound quality is only okay. I am thinking about getting some external speakers.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV for the Money!
Reviews.Author: DPRIMM
Reviews.Content: I bought this on a whim because it was on sale for $250 for a 40" LED 1080P display. I use it for gaming and so far it has been worth the purchase price. Colours look good response time seems good I was not expecting anything amazing so nothing has disappointing me with regards to the display itself. My only real complaint is that it does not appear to read MP4 or AVI files off a memory stick, actually I do not think it reads any video format maybe I am missing something. For the price I can't really complain though. I have even hooked it up to my computer as a 2nd display for gaming and it works very well for that as well. For $250 you can't go wrong with this 40" TV/Monitor Display

Reviews.Title: awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: This TV went above and beyond my expectations,especially for how cheap it was, sound is not great though.P.S. to program a remote, you have to use Sony's code.

Reviews.Title: I love this tv for the price it has a great picture
Reviews.Author: barbara mccullum
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because for the price it has a great picture as compared to my Sony and Vizio. The only dislike I have is it takes a long time to turn on. Other than that I highly recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: GOOD TV
Reviews.Author: Fabian cam
Reviews.Content: For the price is a good tv. Only sound is very high in number 1 in the night is high ideal if between 1 and 0 other level...

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV!
Reviews.Author: save our country "spread the truth!"
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was a terrific purchase; by far the best value in a 40" LCD TV! Brilliant colors, rich blacks, better sound than many others I've seen. Mounted to a wall, so can't speak to the base, but it seems fine. If it lasts, then this is an amazing product.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Mitun
Reviews.Content: I just received this tv a couple days ago after buying it to replace my 4 year old 32 inch Sharp TV. Long story short, this TV is exactly what you would expect at $250. Like most people, i was skeptical about this brand and its connection with Sceptre, but i was pleasently surprised with the TV at first glance. Its very thin, very light (about 10 lbs lighter than my 32 inch sharp, even though it was still a flat screen LCD), and had an ample selection of ports. The ones that i actually use and care about are very accessible, (3 HDMI, 1 USB, and Audio out) but the rest are kind of a pain to reach as they are under the backside of the tv.Pros:1080p 40 inch tv for only 250good picture quality relative to the price3 HDMI ports, which is kind of unheard of for something this cheapthin, light, and attractive bezelCons:sound quality is very poor, and frankly weird..picture takes a lot of adjusting before it meets expectationsOverall this is a great TV so far, especially at this pricepoint. The only reason i would give it 4 stars is because it is not perfect, but for $250 bucks perfect was not a realistic expectation. For those who don;t know, Ocosmo TV's are made by Sceptre which doesn't have such a good reputation. They claim Ocosmo is their "higher end" brand, but we'll see! I got the 3 year warranty just in case since it was only 20 bucks, hopefully this TV will hold up!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: sptacy
Reviews.Content: For the low cost of this TV I was skeptical in purchasing a brand I had never heard of but after reading the reviews and knowing I had a limited budget I decided to go for it.  The review were dead on (the good ones that is).  I am amazed at the picture quality.  The sound was also amazing so the complaints indicated in the comments make no sense to me.  It is light weight and swivels on the base. It does the screen does measure 40 inches.  This is a great TV and I would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: I Recommend this
Reviews.Author: mds0710
Reviews.Content: No problem with the tv after receiving the second one (the first was missing pieces). Works great, great picture and sound quality. great tv. not a name brand but shows no difference in performance. great price. excelllent product.

Reviews.Title: Another Fake ***** Review absolutely Love It.
Reviews.Author: Droid
Reviews.Content: I bought this OCOSMO TV/Monitor a week ago, it arrived in two days Prime.  Picture is fantastic and my other TVs are an expensive Panasonic 50" Plasma and a high end Samsung.  The picture is crisper. sharper than the Panasonic  and every bit is good as the Samsung if not better.  It came very well packaged  and was easy to setup.  The screwdriver that was included was a real commercial screwdriver it was still inadequate. As a monitor it works better than the Panasonic and as well as the Samsung with perfect alignment.  All three HDMI work fine.  Besides the three HDMI it also has component inputs, composite and co-ax cable input for digital TV or Cable without set top box.  It also has a SPDIF digital output  but not optical like the Samsung and Panasonic has.  This is a downer for me as the LG 1000 Watt home theater receiver I have has an optical input not an RCA type wired digital auto input but the sound is fine through the HDMI.  The FIOS set top box has an optical audio connection so I used that to connect to the receiver as well.  To its credit besides the VGA input it also has a mini-jack input for the PC sound.  What I like about the sound is its clarity.  The Panasonic TV has good definition excellent  bass and treble but it is hard to understand what the characters are saying, OCOSOMO has great clear midrange.  The HI-FI 5 point audio I am running from the FIOS DVR HDMI output into the receiver which also has an HDMI output into the TV.  There is also a headphone output on the TV.  Unlike the Panasonic Plasma the OCOSMO runs very cool as does the Samsung with a yearly estimated energy cost of $12.30 so you can't heat your room with it.  The remote is light and fully adequate and easy to use, the Verizon FIOS remote uses SONY setting 0027 for OCOSMO at least for the Motorola remote that has four device selector buttons.  Another feature I like about the OCOSMO is it is light and thin even more so than the Samsung and the on TV controls are easy to access being on the side.  Another nice input is the USB (which is used for displaying HD wholesome family pictures of course).  Most of the time I use this as a PC monitor which is flawless with auto adjustment right out of the box.  If there is a downside the manual could use some improvement as it does not identify which is HDMI one, two and three so you have to figure it out.  It would seem to me to be an easy thing to identify in the manual what are inputs and what are outputs.  Overall it is one of the best purchases I have ever made but just in case I bought the additional warranty as well.  So far it is the deal of the century!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for an excellent picture.
Reviews.Author: Riotgirrl73 "E."
Reviews.Content: I have been shopping for an inexpensive television set for some time.  I passed on the Walmart deal on Black Friday (quality concerns and I generally dislike the company) and a deal popped up on this set last week.  I received the set today.  Easy to put together-four screws in the base, quick set up guide.  Picture is ok-I have a Roku HD and noticed that the picture seemed a little fuzzy.  The sound is not the best, but for the price it is not worth worrying about.Overall, you cannot beat the quality of this TV for $249.Edit: After some digging, I found an antenna and hooked it up to the TV-what a difference!  The picture is crisp and clear, the channel scan took less than a minute.  For some reason, my HD Roku with an HDMI cable is only coming in at 480p.  I think my next purchase will be the Roku 3.I am extremely pleased and would purchase again!

Reviews.Title: You wiil love it!
Reviews.Author: Cool Heel
Reviews.Content: By reading most other reviews and this I really hope you are ready to hit the buy button.. Looked around Best Buy, Costco, Sears.  There are many great 1080p TV's today...Recently purchased a Vizio M style thin with all apps. Just a super TV.  This Ocosmo is so good I might could haved saved hundreds. No regrets on Vizio as its larger and has things that don't require Roku. This Ocosmo is fantastic all around. Picture, sound both are good.  Actually picture is excellent.  A few of the people reviewing act as if they are with Consumer Reports. Most of us buy a tv just to watch and listen, or games or maybe an extra large monitor.  This tv has good buttons on remote for picture and sound. click thru appx 4 choices each and you will find good picture and sound. If not try menu to fine tune it. I'm on Directv and have nothing but praise for this 40 inch tv. absolutely beautiful picture for $250 sale price.  disconnected older flat screen, connected Hdmi cable and power cord. Over the Air antenna and it's up and running. Out of box so simple to set up. lay on bed or well protected area and attach 4 screws with included screwdriver. Don't over tighten screws (very snug only) as base turns side to side for better viewing. Set up is short for enjoyable TV. (PS) Found that printed book for owners manual with full color and instructions were very good.Tried to stop UPS driver saying it must be a Costco delivery ordered on 11/30 STILL NOT RECIEVED.  No he said I have a tv from Amazon for you...2 days from purchase..  3 days earlier than they said. Free delivery....way to go Amazon.  Who needs Drones with UPS .Unless defective you will be delighted..  Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Worth it
Reviews.Author: Austin Ament
Reviews.Content: Very good picture quality, especially for the price. Compares to my 1080p Samsung I have in my living room. GET IT

Reviews.Title: New brand of Sceptre, perfect picture
Reviews.Author: thecaliforniakid
Reviews.Content: This is the same Sceptre company that had the most highly rated 38" TV on Amazon about a year ago. I purchased that one too, and I can say that this oCosmo is essentially the same. The picture is perfect, even the menus are the same as the Sceptre that I loved so much. Everyone seems to be adding their own preferred sound system, since the stock sound is just OK.The Roku Ready feature is made for the Roku Streaming Stick ($90), and makes it a Smart TV rather affordably, with no cables or visible boxes.I highly recommend this

Reviews.Title: Great Decision to Buy!! Price was right, jumping on the oCosmo Bandwagon
Reviews.Author: Bradley Berry
Reviews.Content: Yes i was definitely skeptic of the brand and the TV. But on Black Friday i saw the price for this TV and I went for it. Definitely glad i did. I really was impressed with the packaging. Very solid, all the documentation was in little zip lock baggies. Even comes with a small screwdriver for the stand. Maybe this is standard now, because its been a few since i have purchased a new TV. But if this TV goes on sale again at the Black Friday Price I will definitely buy another. Very satisfied!! The TV looks great. Hooked up over the AIR, Cable, and Computer feeds to this and have no complaints. Setup was nice and i like the interface for the TV. I didnt realize the Roku ready basically means you can just buy the roku streaming stick and its ready to go. A Coupon was provided with mine to get 10 bucks off one.  My only complaint is the remote doesnt feel natural in my hand. But other than that... Very Happy!

Reviews.Title: Like... Alot!
Reviews.Author: G. Long
Reviews.Content: Many reviews use the word, "for the price" it's a good TV and I'm here to say, it's a good TV period. For the sake of having a TV & flat screen have been reluctant. We still have a 60" projection that works great, the picture can't compare. WOW, what a great picture this has, really crisp. Lots of connections, antenna, VGA, hdmi. My 22 year old broke free from her laptop to come in our room and watch it.Just when I thought I was free... ;)I chose the free standard delivery option of 8 to 10 days, it took every bit of the 8 to 10 days to arrive. The TV was well packed with a remote, batteries, color manual, sturdy stand and good instructions with proper English.

Reviews.Title: Incredibly Simple
Reviews.Author: Dean Tomlinson
Reviews.Content: I think other brands should learn a thing or two about making a TV that is easy to use with great picture too. The picture and sound are amazing for a $250 HDTV

Reviews.Title: Just purchased Cosmo tv
Reviews.Author: megan rizae
Reviews.Content: the tv way really easy to set up. I got I ordered it Sunday night and got the tv wed morning. The picture is great just took some tweaking. super light weight. Im still waiting on my warranty to come in the mail. but over all my boyfriend loves it.

Reviews.Title: Good
